acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 48 hours LC50=1.45mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LC50 (4 hour inhalation exposure) of 4.29mg/L (IUCLID, 2000).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 10mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2000-49, 2001).

carcinogenicity.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Group 2B by IARC (2005, in preparation).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity was Category 2 and bio-accumulation was low (BCF=14 (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), since it was a metallic compound and the underwater action was unknown, it was classified into Category 2.

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

explosives.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases
flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on positive data on heritable mutagenicity tests (dominant lethal tests), described in CICAD 29 (2001).

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Based on the classification by UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods (Category 6.1, UN#2862)

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

reproductive_toxicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
reproductive_toxicity.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on male fertility and foetal development at dosing levels toxic to parent animals, described in CICAD 29 (2001) and NTP TR507 (2002).

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no atom groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the evidence of "moderate irritation" from rabbit eye irritation tests (RTECS, 2004).

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water - water solubility: 0.8g/100mL, ICSC (2004)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system, blood system, nervous system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system, blood system, nervous system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "cough, bronchitis, serious respiratory irritation, a few cases of abnormal hemoglobin levels (details not available), palpitation, debility and nervous asthenia" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-49, 2001) and the evidence from animal studies including "nasal hemorrhage, nasal secretion, focal pulmonary edema, fatty degeneration associated with focal necrosis of hepatocytes" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-49, 2001). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory system, blood system, liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, blood system, liver, kidney)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "severe upper respiratory irritation, upper respiratory damage, asthma, bloody phlegm, anemia, an increase in white blood cell counts, albuminuria, urinary casts, bloody urine and tremor" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-49, 2001) and the evidence from animal studies including "pulmonary edema" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-49, 2001) and "watery eyes, diarrhea, hepatocyte necrosis and swelling of renal tubules" (CICAD 29, 2001). The substance was classified as Category 1 instead of Category 3 (Respiratory Irritation), based on the human evidence of "severe upper respiratory irritation". The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 1.
